page.title: 09HOUSING (a)
page.content: There are still many rows of terraced houses in Pleasley which belonged to the National Coal Board; although since the colliery closed some of the houses have been demolished, that is the older ones, while the others have been sold and are owned by the public. In a recent survey 60% of the people in Pleasley are owners of their own homes.There are a small number of private houses being built at the moment - July l985. The local council, Mansfield District Council are the owners of many rows of terraced houses for which the tennants pay rent. There are other houses owned by other people who have tennants paying rent.These are the more wealthy people who are property owners.During the past two years a block of thirty eight modern flats have been built for the elderly.
